== Git hosting ==

=== Public Git hosting sites ===
* Public Git hosting site, maintained by Petr Baudis
** http://repo.or.cz/
* Savannah git hosting
** [http://savannah.gnu.org/maintenance/UsingGit Document]
** http://git.sv.gnu.org/gitweb/ 
* [http://tuxfamily.org Tuxfamily] git hosting (free software only, moderators speak english, french and spanish)
** http://git.tuxfamily.org/ (gitweb)
* [http://gitorious.org/ Gitorious] (by Johan SÃ¸rensen, in Ruby)
** [http://rashkovskii.com/articles/2008/1/9/gitorious Gitorious] post on [http://rashkovskii.com/ Yurii Rashkowskii's blog]
* [http://github.com/ GitHub]
** http://github.com/
* repoz.org, a public and free Git repository hosting service
** http://repoz.org/

=== Project specific Git hosting sites ===
* http://hosted.fedoraproject.org/ (Primarily Fedora related but open to other Free software projects too)
* [http://alioth.debian.org/ Alioth] (project hosting, modified [http://gforge.org GForge] engine, managed by [http://www.debian.org/ Debian] project)
** [http://www.debian.org/News/weekly/2006/34/ Debian Weekly News #34 - August 22nd, 2006] (announcement)
** [http://roland.entierement.nu/blog/2006/08/17/bits-about-alioth.html Roland weblog - Bits about Alioth] (description)
** [http://wiki.debian.org/AliothGit [[AliothGit]]] page on [http://wiki.debian.org/ Debian Wiki]
** http://git.debian.org/
* Linux related projects
** http://www.kernel.org/git
* Freedesktop (X Window System desktops) projects
** http://www.freedesktop.org/wiki/ (homepage)
** http://gitweb.freedesktop.org (gitweb)
